Food source: A variety of plants and insects to support different types of animals and provide them with nutrition.
Shelter: A selection of natural or man-made structures to provide protection from the elements and predators.
Resting areas: Comfortable spots for animals to sleep, such as hammocks or burrows.
Socializing spaces: Areas where animals can interact and form bonds with one another.
Sensory enrichment: Stones, tree trunks, or other objects for animals to explore and investigate, as well as hiding spots for them to observe their surroundings.
